issue.title: [Python] Add Python Flight implementation to integration testing
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4575](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4575). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4575?focusedCommentId=16793769) by David Li (lidavidm):*
The integration script needs support for marking tests as XFAIL since dictionaries aren't supported in Flight so far.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4575?focusedCommentId=17286044) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Do we still want to do this? This seems like a large chunk of work for little gain (the C++ binding should always be preferred).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4575?focusedCommentId=17286070) by David Li (lidavidm):*
I think I meant for this to be, adding the Python Flight _bindings_ to the integration tests. But there's not too much value in that either, yes. I'd be in favor of dropping this.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4575?focusedCommentId=17286084) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Ok, closing then.
